options.systemMessage:
FMC Operations Assistant. Query/Create/Edit/Delete/Export orders, order_items, invoices, invoice_items.

ðŸ”´ CRITICAL PAGINATION WORKFLOW:
Step 1: Count first (Count_Records with type), then Get_Records with offset=0
Step 2: "next" â†’ offset + 10, "previous" â†’ max(0, offset - 10)
âš ï¸ ALWAYS call the tool again for next/previous!

TOOLS OVERVIEW:

ðŸ“– READ Tools:
â€¢ Count_Records: {type: 'order'|'invoice'} â†’ get total counts
â€¢ Get_Records: {type: 'order'|'invoice', supplier?, date_from?, date_to?, offset} â†’ max 10
â€¢ Get_Record_Items: {type: 'order'|'invoice', record_id} â†’ get line items
â€¢ Search_Record: {type: 'order'|'invoice', id} â†’ fast UUID lookup
â€¢ Get_Alert_Thresholds: get active alert configs

ðŸ“Š ANALYTICS Tools:
â€¢ RPC: {date_from?, date_to?} â†’ get monthly totals for orders AND invoices
  - Use for: 'monthly totals', 'analytics', 'monthly summary' requests
  - Returns aggregated monthly data - format clearly with month names
  - Default date range: all time if not specified

âž• CREATE Tools:
â€¢ Create_Record: {type: 'order'|'invoice', supplier (required), date?, total_amount?, net_amount?, ...}
  - For orders: source_channel?
  - For invoices: exchange_rate?, financing_type?

âœï¸ UPDATE Tools:
â€¢ Update_Record: {type: 'order'|'invoice', id, ...fields to update}
â€¢ Update_Record_Item: {type: 'order'|'invoice', id, ...fields to update}

ðŸ—‘ï¸ DELETE Tools (CONFIRM FIRST):
â€¢ Delete_Record: {type: 'order'|'invoice', id}
â€¢ Delete_Record_Item: {type: 'order'|'invoice', id}
â€¢ Show record, ask "Type YES to confirm", then delete

ðŸ“¦ BULK Operations:
â€¢ Bulk_Update_Records: {type: 'order'|'invoice', ids: [uuid array], ...fields}
â€¢ Bulk_Delete_Records: {type: 'order'|'invoice', ids: [uuid array]} - REQUIRES CONFIRMATION

ðŸš¨ HIGH-VALUE ALERTS:
â€¢ When creating orders/invoices with total_amount > 50,000, mention it's a high-value transaction
â€¢ Use Get_Alert_Thresholds to check current threshold settings

ðŸ“¥ EXPORT RULES:
â€¢ Output ONLY the marker line (no extra text):
  [EXPORT_ORDERS] or [EXPORT_INVOICES]
â€¢ With filters: [EXPORT_ORDERS supplier=Acme from=2024-01-01 to=2024-12-31]

ðŸ“ˆ CHARTS:
â€¢ Step 1: Call RPC tool to get monthly data
â€¢ Step 2: Output ONLY the chart marker (no other text)

Single dataset (orders OR invoices):
[CHART_GENERATED]{"chart_type":"bar","chart_title":"Monthly Orders","chart_labels":["Jan 2024","Dec 2024"],"chart_data":[386000,30000],"chart_caption":"Order totals"}

Comparison chart (orders AND invoices - blue vs red):
[CHART_GENERATED]{"chart_type":"bar","chart_title":"Orders vs Invoices","chart_labels":["Jan 2024","Dec 2024"],"chart_data_orders":[386000,30000],"chart_data_invoices":[542000,60000],"chart_caption":"Comparison"}

âš ï¸ CHART RULES:
- Output ONLY the marker line, no text before or after
- chart_type: "bar", "line", or "pie"
- Arrays must have same length
- Use chart_data for single dataset, OR chart_data_orders + chart_data_invoices for comparison

DATES: Parse natural language. RESPONSE: Plain text, numbers with commas.

nodes.name: Get_Records
nodes.notes: Retrieves up to 10 orders or invoices with pagination. Parameters: type ('order' or 'invoice', required), offset (default 0), supplier (optional filter), date_from (optional), date_to (optional).

nodes.name: Get_Record_Items
nodes.notes: Retrieves line items for a given order or invoice. Parameters: type ('order' or 'invoice', required), record_id (the order_id or invoice_id).

nodes.name: Count_Records
nodes.notes: Returns total count of orders or invoices. Parameters: type ('order' or 'invoice', required). Use this before pagination to know total records.

parameters.text: ={{ (() => { let text = $json.output || ''; /* Remove export markers */ text = text.replace(/\[?EXPORT_(ORDERS|INVOICES)\]?[\s\S]*/gi, '').trim(); /* Remove chart markers and JSON */ text = text.replace(/\[?CHART_?GENERATED\]?\s*\{[^}]*\}/gi, '').trim(); text = text.replace(/CHART_?GENERATED[\s\S]*$/gi, '').trim(); /* Clean up tool output prefixes */ if (text.includes('Used tools:')) { const markers = ['Showing', 'Here are', 'There are', 'Order', 'Invoice', 'No ', 'I ', 'Generating', 'Export', 'Monthly', 'For']; for (const m of markers) { const idx = text.indexOf(m); if (idx > 0) { text = text.substring(idx).trim(); break; } } } /* Remove any remaining JSON-like data */ text = text.replace(/\{[^}]*chart[^}]*\}/gi, '').trim(); text = text.replace(/\{"(id|records|type)":[^}]+\}/g, '').trim(); /* If only chart was requested, return empty to avoid duplicate message */ if (!text || text.length < 5) return ''; return text; })() }}

parameters.jsonBody: ={{ JSON.stringify(Object.fromEntries(Object.entries({ supplier: $json.supplier, [($json.type === 'invoice' ? 'invoice_date' : 'order_date')]: $json.date, total_amount: $json.total_amount, net_amount: $json.net_amount, source_channel: $json.type !== 'invoice' ? $json.source_channel : undefined, exchange_rate: $json.type === 'invoice' ? $json.exchange_rate : undefined, financing_type: $json.type === 'invoice' ? $json.financing_type : undefined }).filter(([k, v]) => v !== undefined && v !== null && v !== ''))) }}

nodes.name: Update_Record
nodes.notes: Updates an order or invoice by id. Parameters: type ('order' or 'invoice', required), id (required), plus any fields to update.

parameters.jsonBody: ={{ JSON.stringify(Object.fromEntries(Object.entries({ product_code: $json.product_code, item_id: $json.item_id, description: $json.description, units: $json.units, unit_price: $json.unit_price, batch_number: $json.batch_number, amount: $json.amount }).filter(([k, v]) => v !== undefined && v !== null && v !== ''))) }}

nodes.name: Update_Record_Item
nodes.notes: Updates an order item or invoice item by id. Parameters: type ('order' or 'invoice', required), id (required), plus any fields to update.

nodes.name: Delete_Record
nodes.notes: Deletes an order or invoice by id. CASCADE will delete related items. Always confirm with user before calling. Parameters: type ('order' or 'invoice', required), id (required).

nodes.name: Delete_Record_Item
nodes.notes: Deletes an order item or invoice item by id. Always confirm with user before calling. Parameters: type ('order' or 'invoice', required), id (required).

parameters.jsonBody: ={{ JSON.stringify($json.type === 'invoice' ? { supplier: $json.supplier, invoice_date: $json.date || new Date().toISOString().split('T')[0], total_amount: $json.total_amount || 0, net_amount: $json.net_amount || 0, exchange_rate: $json.exchange_rate || 1, financing_type: $json.financing_type || 'Credit' } : { supplier: $json.supplier, order_date: $json.date || new Date().toISOString().split('T')[0], total_amount: $json.total_amount || 0, net_amount: $json.net_amount || 0, source_channel: $json.source_channel || 'Chat' }) }}

nodes.name: Create_Record
nodes.notes: Creates a new order or invoice. Parameters: type ('order' or 'invoice', required), supplier (required), date (defaults to today), total_amount, net_amount. For orders: source_channel. For invoices: exchange_rate, financing_type.

nodes.name: Search_Record
nodes.notes: Searches for an order or invoice by ID (UUID). Returns full record details. Parameters: type ('order' or 'invoice', required), id (required).

nodes.name: Get_Alert_Thresholds
nodes.notes: Gets active alert thresholds. Returns alert_type, threshold_amount, notify_telegram_ids.

parameters.jsonBody: ={{ JSON.stringify(Object.fromEntries(Object.entries({ supplier: $json.supplier, [($json.type === 'invoice' ? 'invoice_date' : 'order_date')]: $json.date, total_amount: $json.total_amount, net_amount: $json.net_amount, source_channel: $json.type !== 'invoice' ? $json.source_channel : undefined, exchange_rate: $json.type === 'invoice' ? $json.exchange_rate : undefined, financing_type: $json.type === 'invoice' ? $json.financing_type : undefined }).filter(([k, v]) => v !== undefined && v !== null && v !== ''))) }}

nodes.name: Bulk_Update_Records
nodes.notes: Bulk updates multiple orders or invoices. Parameters: type ('order' or 'invoice', required), ids (array of UUIDs, required), plus fields to update.

nodes.name: Bulk_Delete_Records
nodes.notes: Bulk deletes multiple orders or invoices. CASCADE will delete related items. REQUIRES CONFIRMATION. Parameters: type ('order' or 'invoice', required), ids (array of UUIDs, required).

nodes.name: Send_Export_File
nodes.notes: Sends CSV file via Telegram. Expects binary data and filename in JSON.

nodes.name: Check_Export_Request
nodes.notes: Detects [EXPORT_ORDERS] or [EXPORT_INVOICES] markers in AI output and generates CSV.

nodes.name: Generate_CSV
nodes.notes: Converts fetched data array to CSV and attaches as binary file.
